GapFillInput.Title: Describing characteristics
GapFillInput.Instruction: Work out the anagram in each sentence and then type the word into the gap.

Content.Question:
1. Susie’s a bit of a loner, as she doesn’t seem to need to talk to anyone and goes off on her own most weekends. (relno)
2. I wish that some of my colleagues would be more direct and not beat about the bush. (tabe)
3. It’s annoying seeing colleagues creep around the boss just because they want a pay rise or a promotion. (perec)
4. Jane is self-employed and loves working for herself and she hates being told what to do by other people. (dlot)
5. My grandfather told me that it is important in life to keep a sense of who you are and not lose
your individuality. (dniviidualiyt)
6. Rosa was grateful for the education that her parents had worked so hard to provide for her. (lufategr)
7. Pete shows a great deal of care and attention to his work. He’s a methodical and conscientious worker. (conicsentoisu)
8. Mark always has a flattering remark for the ladies. He’s a real womaniser. (anmowiser)
9. Tim and Luke are very close friends. They are always exchanging confidences. (fidnocencse)
10. Harry likes showing off. He’s always telling people how clever he is and how well he’s doing in his job. (wishngo)
